messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning]
messages.msgSnippet: One of our regular family stories (which was quoted today, in regards to this current list problem) is Kirby, when he was five or six, asking me Mom, why is
messages.messageBody:
One of our regular family stories (which was quoted today, in regards to this current list problem) is Kirby, when he was five or six, asking me "Mom, why is Kyla older than Dane?"
As I took a breath to answer, he said, "And don't say it's because she was born first."

Well...

Okay. I didn't.

Ther e was no other answer, but having been instructed what answer was unacceptable, I just laughed.

But honestly, Kyla WAS born first, through no fault or virtue on the part of anyone involved. It was just a simple truth.

So when someone puts any advance limitations on an answer they want, the shorthand here is "...and don't say it's because she was born first."



Sandra
